Machine

Contains general machine routines

Functions
IsProgramActive
call Machine.IsProgramActive(
&boolProgramActive
);

Queries if a program is currently executing

Response Parameters
&boolProgramActive

If a program is NOT active, 0.  If a program is active, Non-Zero.

IsDryRunModeOn
call Machine.IsDryRunModeOn(
&value
);

Queries if the machine is currently in Dry Run Mode

Response Parameters
&value

If in Dry Run Mode, TRUE.  Otherwise, FALSE.

See Also

  • Machine.TurnDryRunModeOn

  • Machine.TurnDryRunModeOff

TurnDryRunModeOn
call Machine.TurnDryRunModeOn();

Commands the machine to enter Dry Run Mode

See Also

  • Machine.IsDryRunModeOn

  • Machine.TurnDryRunModeOff

TurnDryRunModeOff
call Machine.TurnDryRunModeOff();

Commands the machine to leave Dry Run Mode

See Also

  • Machine.IsDryRunModeOn

  • Machine.TurnDryRunModeOff

GetTimeStamp
call Machine.GetTimeStamp(
&str
);

Requests the current time as a string

Response Parameters
&str

the current time

GetMachineInfo
call Machine.GetMachineInfo(
&strSerialNumber,
&strMachineType
);

Requests information about the machine

Response Parameters
&strSerialNumber

the machine serial number

&strMachineType

the machine type/model

GetSystemTime
call Machine.GetSystemTime(
&sysTime
);

Requests a numeric value representing the current system time

Note

This value is the number of seconds that have elapsed since Jan. 1st, 1970

Response Parameters
&sysTime

a numeric value representing the current system time, suitible for comparison

IsLastBackupRecoveredFrom
call Machine.IsLastBackupRecoveredFrom(
&recovered
);

Query the state of recovery after a power event

Response Parameters
&recovered

If the machine has recovered, TRUE.  Otherwise, FALSE.

LastBackupDateTime
call Machine.LastBackupDateTime(
&backupDT
);

Query the chronology of the last backup

Response Parameters
&backupDT

the last backup date/time
